title: How to Turn Off Low Power Mode on Your Apple, Android, or Windows Device

steps.title: Go to your iPhone’s Settings.
steps.content: Go to your iPhone’s Settings. Settings can be found on the home screen. It’s symbolized with a gray gear. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Battery.
steps.content: Tap Battery. Once you’re in Settings, scroll down and select Battery. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the power switch.
steps.content: Tap the power switch. Once you’ve selected Battery, press the switch next to Low Power Mode. The switch should toggle from green to gray, which indicates that you’ve turned off Low Power Mode. [3] X Research source If you wish to turn low power mode back on, simply click this same switch.

steps.title: Swipe to open Control Center.
steps.content: Swipe to open Control Center. To turn off low power mode via the Control Center, swipe up or down on your screen depending on your phone’s model. If you have an iPhone X or later (or any iPad), swipe down from the top right hand corner of the screen. If you have an iPhone 8, SE, or earlier, swipe up from the bottom. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Battery.
steps.content: Tap Battery. In the bottom left of your Control Center’s features, click the glowing yellow battery symbol. The battery icon should switch from yellow to white to demonstrate that your phone is no longer in Low Power Mode. [5] X Research source If you don’t see a battery icon in your device's control center, you can add Low Power Mode in the settings feature by clicking Control Center and Customize Controls.

steps.title: Swipe up on your Apple Watch to access the control center.
steps.content: Swipe up on your Apple Watch to access the control center. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Battery.
steps.content: Tap Battery. Select the battery percentage icon in the bottom left corner of the screen. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the power switch.
steps.content: Tap the power switch. Tap the power switch in your battery settings to turn Low Power Mode off and on. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Press the digital crown.
steps.content: Press the digital crown. If you would prefer to control your device’s power mode from the Settings function, press the digital crown on the side of your Apple Watch. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Select Settings from the drop-down menu.
steps.content: Select Settings from the drop-down menu. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Battery.
steps.content: Tap Battery. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the power switch.
steps.content: Tap the power switch. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Go to your Android’s settings.
steps.content: Go to your Android’s settings. To turn low power mode off on your Android, click on your phone’s Settings option. It looks like white gear inside of a gray box. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Device Care.
steps.content: Tap Device Care. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Battery, then Power Saving Mode.
steps.content: Tap Battery, then Power Saving Mode. Once you’ve opened Device Care, tap the Battery icon in the bottom left corner of your screen. After you’ve clicked Battery, tap the power switch to deactivate Power Saving Mode. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Select the Apple drop-down menu.
steps.content: Select the Apple drop-down menu. To turn off Low Power Mode on your mac, move your mouse to the top left corner of your screen and click the Apple logo. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Click on System Preferences.
steps.content: Click on System Preferences. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Select Battery.
steps.content: Select Battery. Once you’re in System Preferences, move your mouse to the green battery icon and click. [18] X Research source

steps.title: Click on Battery (again).
steps.content: Click on Battery (again). After you’ve activated the Battery options, you’ll be presented with 4 features: Usage History, Battery, Power Adapter, and Schedule. Select Battery from this menu. [19] X Research source

steps.title: Click Low Power Mode.
steps.content: Click Low Power Mode. In the Battery menu, click the checked Low Power Mode box to turn off Low Power Mode. [20] X Research source

steps.title: Click Start.
steps.content: Click Start. To turn Low Power Mode off for your Windows PC, start (pun intended) by clicking the Start button at the bottom edge of the screen. Start is a small icon that displays the Windows logo. [21] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If your computer is a Windows 10 or earlier, you can turn off Low Power Mode by simply clicking the battery icon in the taskbar.

steps.title: From the Start menu, click Settings.
steps.content: From the Start menu, click Settings. Once you’ve clicked the Start button, click Settings from the drop-down menu. [22] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Power.
steps.content: Click Power. In the System menu, scroll down and click the power icon. [23] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Choose your most optimal power mode.
steps.content: Choose your most optimal power mode. Once you’ve selected the Power option, you’ll have your choice in battery function. Your options will be: Best Power Efficiency, Balanced, and Best Performance. Best Power Efficiency is the closest option to low power mode, so, to de-activate it, click Best Performance or Balanced instead. [24] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Even without Power Saving Mode, you can extend your computer’s battery with other methods like reducing your number of tasks and editing your brightness.
